summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) detailing a witness's account of being recruited for massages at Jeffrey Epstein's properties, which escalated to unwanted sexual advances. The witness describes travel to Epstein's island, the presence of other young women, and threats made by Epstein regarding her modeling career.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of coercing the witness into massages that became increasingly invasive, arranging travel to his island, and threatening her career.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Present for the interview as a detective.

persons.name: Jean Luc Brunel
persons.context: Epstein arranged an interview for the witness with Brunel; the witness went from Epstein's home to Brunel's home.

persons.name: Halle Berry
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein during massages as someone he knew.

persons.name: Cuba Gooding Jr.
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein during massages as someone he knew.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein when discussing how he became wealthy.

connections.description: Epstein arranged a modeling interview for the witness with Brunel, indicating a connection in the modeling industry.
Epstein mentioned Wexner when discussing how he became wealthy, suggesting a financial or business association.

events.title: Initial Recruitment and Massages in NYC
events.description: The witness was recruited by a Russian woman at a nightclub to massage Epstein for money. She visited Epstein's Upper East Side townhouse multiple times, where massages occurred in a dedicated room.

events.title: Travel to Epstein's Island
events.description: The witness traveled to Epstein's private island via his plane and helicopter. She spent 2-3 days there with other young women, receiving professional massages and engaging in leisure activities until an incident with Epstein.

events.title: Escalation and Threat
events.description: During a massage, Epstein became rough and forceful. When the witness resisted, he grew angry, threatened her modeling career, and she was escorted off the island.

events.title: Interview with Jean Luc Brunel
events.description: Epstein arranged for the witness to have an interview with modeling executive Jean Luc Brunel, which took place at Brunel's home.

locations: Epstein's Upper East Side townhouse (77th street or similar), New York City
keyFacts: A witness describes a pattern where massages for Epstein, initially presented as non-sexual, escalated to unwanted sexual advances and force.
Epstein used the promise of modeling opportunities (via Jean Luc Brunel) and monetary incentives to recruit and control the witness.
The witness traveled to Epstein's private island via his private plane and helicopter, where she observed other young women, including one she believed was around 17 years old.
Epstein threatened the witness's modeling career when she resisted his advances, stating he had influence with higher-ups in modeling agencies.
Epstein name-dropped celebrities (Halle Berry, Cuba Gooding Jr.) and business associate Les Wexner during interactions with the witness.
